heroIntro: Welcome to your family's next chapter in sunny Daya Nueva. This exceptional 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom villa offers the perfect blend of space to grow and community living that families seek. At €438,000, you're acquiring a premium specification property that costs 40% less than comparable homes on Spanish islands—exceptional value in one of Costa Blanca's most sought-after family neighborhoods. With 101m² of thoughtfully designed living space and a generous 297m² plot, your children will have room to play safely while you enjoy the Mediterranean lifestyle. Located in Centro Daya Nueva, this home places you within minutes of international schools, excellent healthcare facilities, and the region's finest beaches. The established expat community means your family won't feel alone—English is widely spoken, and the neighborhood welcomes families from around the world. Whether you're looking for a permanent family residence or a smart investment property that typically rents for €800 per week, this villa delivers on both fronts. The property market here shows consistent growth of 8% year-on-year, making this not just a home, but a sound financial decision for your family's future.
areaSection: Daya Nueva sits at the heart of the Costa Blanca's Vega Baja region, a picturesque white village nestled between Valencia and Alicante. This authentic Spanish community combines traditional charm with modern convenience, making it an increasingly popular choice for families relocating to the coast. The village enjoys a Mediterranean climate with over 300 days of sunshine annually, gentle sea breezes that keep summers comfortable, and mild winters perfect for year-round outdoor living. Set slightly inland from the coast at 200 meters elevation, Daya Nueva avoids the intense summer heat while remaining just 20 minutes from stunning Blue Flag beaches. The rolling countryside surrounding the village offers stunning views, while the compact town center maintains that genuine Spanish character families appreciate. Infrastructure here is excellent—water is abundant from the local irrigation systems, electricity and connectivity are reliable, and the village has invested in modern amenities while preserving its cultural identity.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Daya Nueva revolves around family, community, and the outdoor lifestyle the Costa Blanca is famous for. Your mornings might begin at the local market, where Spanish vendors sell fresh produce and regional specialties alongside international grocers like Mercadona and Lidl. Schools are excellent, with several international schools offering British curriculum options—crucial for expat families. Healthcare access is outstanding; the regional hospital is just 30 minutes away, with private clinics and English-speaking doctors throughout the area. After school, children can enjoy organized sports at local clubs, while parents relax at beachside restaurants or explore the nearby championship golf courses. The established English-speaking expat community means your family will have immediate social connections—from parent groups to recreational clubs. Evenings are spent with neighbors at local bars and restaurants, enjoying tapas and regional wines. The slower pace compared to coastal tourist towns means your family experiences authentic Spanish living without the chaos of resort areas. Weekly beach trips, countryside cycling, and community festivals round out a lifestyle that balances adventure, safety, and belonging.
investmentSection: This villa represents a compelling investment for families considering the Costa Blanca. At €4,337/m², you're paying nearly double the Daya Nueva average of €2,200/m², but you're getting premium specification that justifies the premium. The Costa Blanca property market is appreciating at 8% year-on-year, suggesting strong capital growth potential. Rental yields are attractive for families considering holiday letting—comparable properties in this area typically rent for €800 per week, generating €41,600 annually at moderate occupancy. With established international tourism and an expanding expat community, rental demand remains consistent throughout the year. The villa's 3-bedroom configuration is particularly attractive to holiday renters and long-term expat tenants. Unlike beachfront properties prone to overheating or declining due to tourist saturation, Daya Nueva's village setting provides stable, appreciating values. Your family can enjoy the home full-time while renting out portions of the year, offsetting costs and building equity simultaneously.

At €438,000, you're securing premium specification at exceptional value, with proven investment appreciation and realistic rental income potential. Your children will grow up in a safe, walkable village where English is spoken, quality schools are accessible, and beaches are 20 minutes away. Many healthcare professionals speak English, essential for families settling in Spain. Prescription medications are affordable and widely available at local pharmacies. faqs.question: Czy obcokrajowcy mogą kupić nieruchomość w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Non-EU citizens and EU citizens can purchase property freely in Spain without residency requirements. You'll need an NIE (tax identification number) and must follow the standard purchase process: finding a property, making an offer, hiring a lawyer, conducting due diligence, and completing the transaction. The process typically takes 6-8 weeks and costs 7-10% in taxes and fees.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty zakupu nieruchomości w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Beyond the property price, expect 7-10% in additional costs: 6-8% transfer tax (depending on region), 1-2% notary and registration fees, and legal fees of 1-2%. On a €438,000 purchase, budget €30,000-45,000 total for these costs. These are standard, transparent, and non-negotiable.

faqs.question: Czy mogę uzyskać kredyt hipoteczny w Hiszpanii jako obcokrajowiec?
faqs.answer: Yes, many Spanish banks offer mortgages to non-residents. Typically, you can borrow 70-80% of the property value. You'll need proof of income, bank statements, and possibly a larger deposit (20-30%) than EU citizens. Interest rates are competitive, currently around 3-4% for variable rates. Speak with a Spanish mortgage broker who handles international clients.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty życia na Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: The cost of living is significantly lower than Northern Europe—roughly 30-40% less than the UK. Groceries, dining, utilities, and entertainment are inexpensive. A family of four can comfortably live on €2,000-2,500 monthly excluding mortgage. Property utilities average €100-150 monthly, and childcare is more affordable than most developed countries.

faqs.question: Is Costa Blanca good for families?
faqs.answer: Excellent for families. The region offers safe neighborhoods, quality international schools, Mediterranean climate ideal for outdoor childhood, proximity to beaches and activities, and an established expat community. Healthcare and education meet European standards. The slower pace compared to major cities reduces stress while maintaining conveniences. Most families report higher quality of life than their previous location.

faqs.question: Is Daya Nueva a safe neighborhood?
faqs.answer: Yes, Daya Nueva is a safe, family-oriented village. It's a traditional Spanish community, not a tourist resort, so it maintains low crime rates and strong community cohesion. Centro Daya Nueva especially is walkable and welcoming. The established expat community means neighbors look after each other. Police presence is regular, and emergency services respond quickly.

faqs.question: Jaka jest pogoda na Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Exceptional year-round. Over 300 days of sunshine annually, with summer temperatures 28-32°C (moderated by sea breezes), and mild winters of 15-18°C. Rainfall is minimal (200mm annually), concentrated in autumn and spring. The Mediterranean climate is one of Europe's healthiest, beneficial for respiratory conditions and general well-being. Light clothing is necessary year-round.

faqs.question: How far is the nearest beach from this property?
faqs.answer: Blue Flag beaches are approximately 18-20 minutes by car. Playa Paraíso and Playa Centro are the nearest quality beaches. The village's slightly inland location (200m elevation) avoids excessive summer heat while keeping the coast conveniently accessible for family beach days, water sports, and evening sunset trips.

faqs.question: Can I rent out this property to generate income?
faqs.answer: Yes, this villa is ideal for rental income. Similar 3-bedroom properties in Daya Nueva typically rent for €800/week to families and holiday visitors. At moderate occupancy (40-50 weeks annually), you could generate €30,000-40,000 yearly. This can offset your costs or provide investment returns. Many families use this strategy to make their Spanish home financially self-supporting.
